components.description:
A baby with a halo and wings. Can represent a sweet baby, a biblical cherub, a mythological cupid, a decorative putto, or an angel as a supernatural being in general. This emoji can be used earnestly or in a tongue-in-cheek way to talk about goodness or innocence.

It is often used to express affection for people, especially children at birth or, more sadly, after death. This emoji pops up in a large variety of contexts ranging from innocence, love, Valentine's Day, positive feelings like gratitude, and the Christian faith, especially during Christmas.

See also ðŸ‘¶ Baby.
components.title: Baby Angel

title: Baby Angel

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.
